comments.text: We are hitching with a sing in a hand. Couple.
Stand there with big sign LJ I had a ride near Logatec to petrol station, a lot of place to stop and some trafic, You can go here by a bus from triest 1,45eur near central station
Made a sign with Ljubljana and got picked up after 3 min by a man that was going to Zagreb, on a Tuesday noon.
Mostly italians they probably won't take you, a slovenian woman took us to the border where it was easier but nice place to hh there is also a supermarket

Direction: Ljubljana, Maribor and also Hungary. Take the tram from Trieste to Villa Opicina, than walk through Strada per Vienna. You will see a big place to hitchhike. Stood here just 20 minutes or less. Have a good luck!

An extremely busy Autogrill! So many German cars going both North and South. For some reason though quite difficult to get to Bologna from here and close to IMPOSSIBLE to go East towards Rimini.
You can ask people directly where they're going or stand with a sign at the exit of the gas station (less effective).
According to my calculations the peak traffic was reached at 1 pm with an average of 60 cars passing in the Southern direction and 40 in the Northern (yes I spent the whole day here, it
Very big traffic and in the Autogrill you can take a shower for free. :D

We arrived there with a bus from Bologna. But to reach the gas station you have to follow a street on the right of the bridge. Than you will find the one side of the gas station. It is difficult to reach the gas station from there because there is a big fence and lots of cameras. But dont be afraid just go back and pass the tunnel to the other side of the highway. There is fence which can be passed easily. After a little bit of fight with bushes you will find a betonwall with holes for trash bin
Got a ride to Slovenia from here

Arrived late in the evening and missed most of the last traffic due to excessive tablediving. One of the best spots I've seen in Europe! In the morning, caught a ride all the way to Biel/Bienne in Switzerland. Great spot!
Got a ride in the direction of Milano in less then 10 minutes

After table-diving a whole plate with chicken schnitzel and fries in the restaurant i got a lift in 1h20min to switzerland.  I asked for a ride towards Verona to hitch via Innesbruck to Munich, but everyone was driving Milano or Switzerland direction, so after an hour or so I decided to take a ride to switzerland to continue to Munich from there.  This stradegy worked fine :)
Been through this very gas station a couple of times, and a lot of people go north toward Austria. The police often comes around but they won't bother you at all :)
I got asked by the police to not stand on the exit of the gas station with my thumb out and to only ask people if they could give me a ride. Was fine though :)

Huge gas station on the highway. Most cars going west, Parma-Milano, but also many north, Verona-Brennero. To get there take the bus from Modena autostazione and get off in "tre olmi" (on school holiday there are few buses and it might be preferable to walk or take another bus half the way). Go left in the roundabout down "strada tre olmi". There's a hotel next to the gas station, and from its parking lot there is a kind of always open swinging gate through the fence.
Nice spot heading up north, you can even use both hand for hitchhiking at the exit from the gas station, I recommend using sign.

10AM thursday morning on early july, going towrds berlin
i spent less than 2 hours asking cars and trucks at the gas station...some trucks going south, until a young guy took meon his truck to munich, he was actually going to berlin but had to stop cus of driving hours
no one from the staff bothered me to walk around the station as it happened elsewhere

10AM thursday morning on early july, going towrds berlin
i spent less than 2 hours asking cars and trucks at the gas station...some trucks going south, until a young guy took meon his truck to munich, he was actually going to berlin but had to stop cus of driving hours
no one from the staff bothered me to walk around the station as it happened elsewhere
perfect for brennero and further. ask polish truckers some go all the way to prague from here

Perfect spot: cheap gas station. Everyone gets here before entering the highway (trucks and cars) It is very easy to talk to people here. Was heading in the direction A22/ Brennero on my way to Innsbruck.
Good spot for torin novara or further(france). I accepted a ride of rew kilometers but the guy gifted me with 10 euro.
Best place to hitch towards West (Torino, France etc). Got a ride to next bigger Autogrill. Easy access as well - metro, bit of walking and through the turnstile for pedestrians.
I asked the first guy and he was going to Torino, where I wanted. Maybe I was just lucky,  but still its a good place to go west.
We were little lucky that one truck took us straight to Milano. This is a good spot even for trucks to stop.

Good and safe place.
The cars can stop easily.
I found a driver to Padova in 15 minutes.
Before a driver wanted to pick me up to Piacenza.

Just in front of the petrol station. From via Gioia goes the most of the cars, going to the highway. We've found a driver in about 30 minutes. It's better than staying near the entrance, because here is more space for cars to stop.
We were taken in 10 minutes there to Torino. I explain on the wiki how to reach the station, as we took some risks the time we tried to go there.

Big petrol station with many people.
Good if you want to reach France or Turin.
There if a brige to get the other side.

It was about 5 PM, 10 minutes we waited - a guy with a pick-up took us. People there drive big cars - it's perfect when you're with two big backpacks. 
The place is a parking and also a bus stop - very good spot for the whole valley up to Breuil-Cervinia.

In the direction of Innsbruck... used sign "A22/Innsbruck". Good spot because the cars can easyly pull over and also it is quite small, th ecars go slow, there is a lot of eyecontact. Was hiking alone.
Waited 5 min with a panel indicating Lienz to get a ride to Brunico.
SS49 towards Bruneck. Perfect spot just behind the toll gates.

Got taken right away into direction Verona. Big autogrill lots of drivers to ask.
Two male hitchhikers.
Summer 2025

I asked my ride to leave me here on my way from Milan to Brescia since I didn't want to enter Bergamo. I was surprised to see that many cars were passing through this gas station even on a Sunday night. 
Eventually got picked up all the way to Brescia relatively quickly. 

P.S. On this Autogrill I came upon a couple of foreign backpackers that were headed to Venezia. They were standing with a sign on the entrance to the gas station, which didn't bring them much success since I found actually
disnt even finish packing my things after making a sign with my friend and an italian guy took us to where we needed
I had sign "Bruneck", got ride by DPD driver to Toblach dobbiaco.
Ride to St Moritz in the night.
Great spot, used many time to get St.Moritz. Enjoy the views!!

Got a ride to Bologna after 30 minutes of smiles.
Invest 1,50â‚¬ by Roger app to get bus 9 from Rimini station to San Vito or train to Santarcangelo and walk from the last stop. Stand before the "no autostop". A young guy saw his wanderer friend in me and picked me up. Traffic is chilled but could be busy in rush hours.

I waited 90 minutes but i think i was just unlucky. Three cars stopped for me but all were going to South and i wanted to go to Bologna. There are enough place for the cars to stop, you can hitchhike before the no autostop sign so its not illegal to do it here. The other entrance to the highway in Rimini is now under construction so probably its the best spot to hitchhike up to the highway for both direction.

quite international, saw D/CH/B/A/I/ cars. girl at the cafe was asking drivers on my behalf :)
reasonable traffic for so early on a saturday
What a spot, I had a sign to Rimini and got picked up by a lovely lady in 15 mins, petrol station for people to drive into, lots of cars going by and traffic so they can see you
We were visiting the wild hot springs there, in Bagni di San Filippo. A nice man took us just to point we need.

We were 2 guys, we wanted to get to Palermo. First car stoped after 1 hour. 
The spot seems perfect. There are a lot of cars, they go slowly and they can see you from distance. But italians are not into taking hitchhikers, so our driver was a Pole (polish men).
Out of the toll, lots of traffic, easy for car to stop and see you
I found a ride very fast. It was winter and this was the first gas station with lots of cars heading south.
Got a ride to Koper in Slovenia, easy to cross border here. There is a bus stop, make a sign.
Not so easy access to this place, but its good if u need to go to Milano, everyone goes there.

Good place for hitchhiking. You can stop just after the traffic lights and pedestrian crossing. There is plenty of place for cars to stop, they go slowly and all of them leave the airport. I had Bolzano/Verona sign and after 10 mins I got a very nice ride to Trent
Lots of traffic towards everywhere. Not sure how easy it is to get to I got dropped off there

2 girls 
Really nice spot the car can stop on a little road just before the "big road" 
We were waiting with a panel PADOVA  
The guy was just stopping in Padova and was going to Florence

Is not a station but is full of cars, good for turin or milan direction. I suggest to stay in the spot where I point because is where all the cars went for the highway. But there you meed a sign(a lot of store you can ask for one).
Perfect spot direction novara or further(torin or france), a small gas station, a lot of space for cars to see you and stop.

Perfect spot(not on hight way), is a small station, there is a bar where I asked for a box paper for my sign. There is a lot of space for cars to see you and stop, is better using your thumb on the road. A guy bring me to the next station gas

The point is this. Yhis all area is a shit area. I spent hours oround there searching for hope. My intent was to take the highway for torin but was very difficult. This spot was not signed but is the only good spot near by. If you are lucky you can meet someone who goes to milan or torin. A guy pick me up and drop me near Novara in a gas station. Best option considereting the bad area.
Got picked up in 10 minutes. Great spot!
Very good spot to get in Savoca. Beauty village known for filming The Godfather. Also if you want get back to Santa Teresa you can try hitchiking. I got to back without doing hitchiking.

Great spot, just before the pedestrian crossing. Afternoon shade, plenty of space for cars to pull over, and there's a stop sign and a pedestrian crossing right after it so people are going very slow, plenty of time to engage with your potential driver.

Waited a while to get a ride to Trento, many cars stopped, but they only drove to the next village so we waited longer, since the spot was amazing and eventually someone towards Trento would stop. Using sign might be helpful, we sadly did not find any cardboard.
very easy to get a ride off-highway towards Trento. Just expect that you will need multiple rides to get there :)
Nice spot, got a ride all the way to Verona

Easy to catch a ride along the SS12 route, ideal for off-highway direction towards Verona. I would recommend taking this route to avoid getting stuck on the highway, its very easy to catch rides all the way to Verona, it took us 3 rides and we waited mby 30 minutes alltogether.
Nice spot to Modena
Nice spot heading towards the lake.

After waiting 4,5h in Peschiera, I was brought here. This service area is quite big and very good to go northwards. I asked truck drivers and others at the gas station, but went to the service shop after 5min. I met two Danes who were traveling from Milano to Kolding, so I got a long distance ride for over 1000km in 14h to Hamburg.

First time hitchhiking and got a ride directly where we needed. Cars go slow after the roundabout, have a spot to stop on the right. Got picked up by an Austrian comming from the dolomites as there's only a few freeways through the mountains. Lots of cars in the summer.
Good spot to Terracina/Fondi/Rome. For us it was really quick. There is a place for a car to stop.
Great spot, people see you from afar. If there are no cars in the parking spot for dropping of goods you are good. Someone stopped when i put the sign up instantly.
Was looking for a ride south along the Adriatic, we found one before we even got to the spot we wanted to hitch from by walking along the SS64 with our thumbs out. Bologna is great!
Very nice spot suggested by workers, a couple of bar where lots of driver stop by.
Very good spot for Genova, we were 2 guys and we found quickly, early in the morning is prety easy. Juste careful the police.
Avvevo mancato il pullman, quasi non ho atteso, altri turisti mi hanno presi subito
Reached by a hole in a small fence. Staff on the station cared about us, gave us plastic bottle full of water:)

We were lucky this time we were litteraly arriving by foot to the spot and managed to stop a car to Verona right then and there. 

The thing is everything points to if your going to Verona from Trento THIS IS THE SPOT ( we were lucky but it still is)

Over all in Italy the highway entry fee spots are the best! ;)
Lot of traffic people going up and down through mountains and Cortina is a popular city and we were going there

Pretty good spot, just before the entrance to the highway. Even when behind me was a sign "NO autostop" as everywhere on the entrances to highway... I was before it so I was fine (?)... Holding a sign "Genova ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡¹" i got a ride directly to the centre
We first waited at rifugio Passo Staulanza for 20minutes with no luck, and moved down here and got picked up in 5mins.
Perfekt spot for a ride to Villach/Austria. Got ride in 2-3min.
Great spot people go to Come very easily
The best spot if you go to milano
Just have to wait 1 minute and someone take me. Perfect spot because there is a place for the car to stop
Perfect to reach Pisa
Ride to Rovigo
Excellent spot
We catch ride in direction to La Spienza with very kind French.
We catch ride in 10 minutes to Como. We were hitchhiking on the side of the road
nice spot at the bus stop...loads of space for cars to stop...i had a sign, and i went even farther than that with a very nice couple

Nice and pretty much the only stop when heading from Brescia in the direction of Iseo. Easy to get here by taking the bus â„–3 from Stazione FS. Lots of people headed to the Franciacorta outlet, especially on the weekends.
Good spot, you're visible and car has a space to stop, easy ride to next town
This road is dangerous to walk, someone pulled over in 5 mins to save us from potential murder
there is a lot of coming and going of people and a great chance of finding a ride
Second longest ride ever, 2,420 kmin a truck.  Detour towards the south to pick up 30 tons of grapes, and via the Frejus tunnel and Luxembourg.
Tore my ACL here trying to impress the beautiful Federica. Luckily the hospital was literally right there. I believe I am still a wanted man in Orbetello for skipping town. 10/10 would reccomend
It worked like a charm!

Best place in the area to get to France - and from there everything is wayyyyyy easier. Service/petrol station just before the tunnel (PS. don't try to hitch a hike from the toll before the tunnel, because it is illegal and you might be moved, instead ask around the petrol station). 
To access it just follow the road via Susa, on the roundabout take the southern exit (road that is parallel to Via Susa) and just follow the road, it will go under the highway and then turn into the highway, from t
Got dropped off by a truck here and someone picked me up right away! Plenty of room for cars to stop!

Donâ€™t try to get here by foot, I walked via the motorway and it was super dangerous. The first people I asked went to Freiburg Germany,  the Gotthardt tunnel closed at night, so if you are late you might have to wait for the morning.

After about 5-10 minutes, I noticed a sign behind me. I can't read Italian, but I assumed it said somehting about being fined for parking in the bus lane. So I left, deciding to try the parking lot of the grocery store. 

When walking to the parking lot, this gentleman and his girlfriend offered me a ride to the train station to get into Milan (my final destination). I found it difficult to refuse Italians, so I condede! They bought me some snacks in the store, which was incredibly generous! A
We were showing our sign with "Bled" to all cars while walking towards the Slovenian border.
Went to Switzerland (Luzern). Good visible spot and cars can pull over easily. A cafÃ© close by provided me with cardboard.
All the cars that go direction west come by here. Easy for them to stop at the bus stop and also they can see you well in advance. There is a bus from Meran center that gets close to here.

In front of the restaurant inn, wide parking next to thÃ© road, perferct spot, Early morning, construction workers on the way to work stoppes me at the first big Town because i was on the pickup deck. Felt lucky
okey traffick and they are slow turnig out of roundabout. Had a sign to Lienz, got dropped off at Sillian
With a sign Palmanova a local guy took us directly to the centrum. Lot of locals going in that direction
2 guys, catched a ride in literal seconds to Milano with "Zurich" sign
many cars, found a ride to Nice (Nizza) within 10min

Very easy spot to leave Pesaro without going far away. I started hitchhiking here to play music in the streets of Rimini recently and got 5 rides in less than 10 minutes - especially in the mid-afternoon with less traffic. A lady even turned back at the roundabout to pick me up in the morning. They averagely dropped me in Cattolica or Misano as furthest.
Compared to drivers in next towns, people here are more smiley, reactive and interested in conversation. Still, they'll go out of their way, l

Direction Ancona and north. Recommended spot if you leave Camerino. Not sure about the new SS256 Pedemontana road - try it and let us know.
I came here by direct bus from Camerino 3â‚¬ via Contram app. Don't follow GMaps, no one crosses Albacina. A lot of viewability + space to stop, no police. It's legal to hitch here. To Rome, Fabriano west works better. 
The first 2 cars offered me 20km, so i waited. A woman entered the free highway and came back >10km to pick me up :D
A really easy day. Got

Got a ride to Pesaro in 3 minutes. This spot can be helpful for short distances within touristic coastal towns (Riccione, Cattolica). Come here either on a 40-50 minutes walk or bus 9, 124. Expect longer waits on rush hours.
Kind elder driver in a new Smart car went out of his way. he told me about his seasonal trips across Sahara and Sahel countries by car in the 70s.
Try your luck!

Easy spot towards Pesaro. Stand before the gas station displays. 2 different men offered me a ride for few kms within 30 minutes. Seems like hitchhiking was popular in the past :) After almost one hour waiting under light rain a young guy took me to Pesaro. After 20.000km across the Middle East and North Africa, it was my first ever hitchhike within the province i grew up in.
Hopefully italians will start trusting us again :)

Direction--->everywhere
Slow cars and vans from the ships/cruises are about to start their journey, most of them smiled or waved at me. Also those driving from "parking north" (opposite the ship i was in) pass by here. As less long-range drivers and tourists pass by there, I don't think the yellow northern spot on this hitch-map could be more strategic.
If the lane on the right is closed, you can stand and wait. Just be respectful of traffic and police will tell you nothing. Some tourists aske
We got a lift to the beach of Marina Julia at the roundabout from a local :)
Perfect pull off area. Man stopped for my after only 20 cars passed and took me right to the place I was staying even though I just asked for Salutio
Got a very quick ride to the terminal bus.
good to get to friuli
perfect to reach mountains
You can get a ride on the local roads when being modest with the distane travelled quite quickly. We were going to the west.
Hitched a car to Udine basically on the first try. Locals were very friendly and didn't make us wait:)

Probably the best spot to go west from Pontebba. Traffic from both, the local and the main road, have enough time to slow down. Locals are very friendly and if you don't far fetch with the destination on your sign, your waiting time might be about 20 minutes.
Probably the best spot to go west from Tarvisio. After about 20 minutes got picked up by locals, which all are very friendly, and got a ride to Pontebba.
Persona super gentile mi ha portato per una breve tratta

As a teenager I used to hitchike almost every day to Amalfi to go to school from this spot. I wanted to give it a rating as it is my first hitchhiking place.

I don't know if it works as good for tourists but try! In the morning it is easier for sure (around 7:30 or 8)

The spot is great. Both sides of the highway are connected together, so you can change the direction just by walking over the highway. 
Easy to go from here to Milano. My destination was Abbiategrasso and I also got direct ride to this place from here.
direction: slovenia (border). Local girl take us for 10-15 km near border:)
to slovenia, locals :))
In 40 minutes, 3 cars stopped. We wanted to go straight to Nice, or they had only one place, so we didn't accept but it is a good spot to go to the south if you want to reach Savona / Nice.
Very quickly we stopped a young German couple because they felt sorry for us (it was their first hitch). It's impossible to get up there without car and buses are going rarely.

We took the third car (so cerca every 20th car stopped). It was a very nice and communicative social worker from SÃ lo and he helped us to get closer to Prabione. Other places more far that road are impossible to go on foot and just a very few buses.
After a few minutes we stopped Marco. We asked for a ride to Montello or Costa di Mezzate. He took us through highways and we had a nice chat.
perfect spot, got a ride to Massa very fast

Loads of car, a beautiful "no autstop" sign but i just waited 10minutes and a single woman with her chil drove me to the country side near portomaggiore where i needed to go. They did a detour for me, i really appreciated.
Idk exactly where i was but i was somewhere on this national road and i got a ride to ferra, to the highway going west to porto maggiore.
Got picked up fast and taken to Palermo. But be careful when crossing this road and with where you stand.
Got picked up fast, even though we were only taken to Castellammare.
Avarage cars, friendly driver took us to Mondovi. We are two and no sign
The place is before gas station and after roundabout. Its very good place how to get from Torino. Italian guy with mercedes took us to Fossano. We havent got a sign. We were two. Lots of cars.
Got picked up very fast and taken to the village center of Scopello.
Got a ride to Sillian very quickly.
Direction Toblach dobbiaco, lot of space for cars to stop.
Got ride to Brixen, two cars stopped in 5minutes.
Bus station, good for direction to Brixen.

Presuming you arrive in Castellamare by train, you'll want to HH because the station is an hour by foot from the town. This location seems to work well. It's not a busy road but not too empty either. 5-10min waiting time.
This spot is good for hitchhiking but dont choose this road to hitchhike far to the North. I hitchhiked to Taormina but was very hard on this road. Probably better on the highway.
we asked around, many people and you can shower inside. good spot. behind the autogrill theres a ruin where you can sleep.
We are 2 guys going to Rome. Many cars stopped there.
2 guys, catched a ride to Florence in about an hour
Many people going for MIlan and Switzerland, but still got a ride to Bologna within 30min

Amazing spot! 
Great to catch a long ride, donâ€™t settle for something close, weâ€™ve got a ride as far as after Florencia :) 

Reasonable prices for food, great big bathroom, restaurant combined with a shop that attracts both family cars and trucks.
got a sketchy ride to milano in about 10 minutes.
Got a ride at 20.00 all the way to Venice! (altough the couple only went to Vicenza, they were concerned and decided to take me all the way :D )
Got an almost instant ride to Mestre.

Very good tankstelle with Autogrill through which is possible to get from one side of the autostrada to the other. This tankstelle is populated by both trucks and city cars which make it a good spot to get rides both short and long range. I found a ride from here to Venice in less than 5 minutes from a truck driver heading to Monfalcone. If You have questions please use the "Contact Me" section on my website www.claudioadrianodobre.com to get in touch with me.
Soave Tankstelle.
2 guys, catched a ride to the gas station near Brescia

Got there from the city centre of Firenze. Took the Regionale 18664 and got off at Pratignone. Didn't buy a ticket although it's not much, 3-4 euros. Then it's a 20min walk from the train stop to the gas station. Italians are really sceptical and most don't speak english as it is the case in most of Italy. Fortunately we got a ride from a Czech family to Brno. Hitching back to Estonia.
Lot of traffic, good reachable spot
kÃ¶nnyen lehet fuvart talÃ¡lni innen Triesztbe. (Gyalog nehÃ©z idejutni de nem lehetetlen ;) )
Got a ride to Trieste pretty easily, by asking arround, even if it was the nigth (18h/6PM in november)

we tried so hard.. we spent 6 hours on the spot, because of truck restrictions.. italiens in small vehicules don't even watch on you, it was too humiliating for us hahahah
so don't hitch here on weekend or sun will dry you to bones
Very perfect spot. After 5 mins we got a ride with young polish couple to Brno!!!

The best spot to go east to Ljubljana, Budapest or northeast towards Wien. Asking truck drivers directly is the best strategy for one person I think. The 5th driver I asked in person was going directly to Northern Hungary which is where I needed to go.
Hitched towards Slovenia from here again in November and got a ride to Ljubljana after 2 minutes!

Got lucky and one of the few drivers took us to innsbruck. Not much traffic but everybody there is heading north. Was around 8:30pm.
Two male hitchhikers
Summer 2025
just got of the car and went straight to the next one which took me to Innsbruck!!! at 11:00pm
Got a lucky lift to Chioggia. It is advantageous if you have a map and speak Italian. The most of them only speak Italian or bad English
I got a ride to Parma after 10 minutes. Just ask parked and refilling cars :)
Read the past message for understand how to reach that. I bought a tick from turin station(2,60â‚¬). Great spot for france, some france cars. A guy dropped me at susa
Follow the instruction of the past rewies, search for the low fench. A lots of france cars. A guy drop me at susa, near the french border.
Easy access (read other comments), many cars and trucks going France way.

Just like Melaine said, take the bus from Turin to Rivoli or Alpignano, then walk to the highway. Follow the gravel track "Via Valle" on 400 meters and then you will find a low fence easy to step over, enter the service station and ask people for a ride. I was lucky, the first driver I asked said yes so it was my fastest hitchhike ever. Do not stick your thumb up or wait with a sign, police will fine you.
I was lucky to get a ride by some italian traveler who spoke perfect English, seems like a good spot to get a ride to Bardonecchia â€” mountain resort in Italy
Wonderful spot, where cars go slow and all enter into the highway. I found a lift toward the place i had on the sign

Good place to hitchhike towards the north(west). Even before the driver who picked us up, multiple others also stopped but went in other directions. It's not on the actual highway so it's not a dangerous place nor (I think) likely to cause problems with police.
Great spot, especially during hollidays. Lot of slow traffic

Totally fine place for autostop, fortunately a some philosop speaking Italian-English stepped by and took me to their hom to swim and give me food. Urfotunately everybody I was talking to said that it is impossible to catch somebody in Italy for autostrada
Worked out well for me!

brilliant. first car i asked was going to bolzano, second took me to milan (but both were taking a longer dinner break). good traffic, showers, dunno how easy to access on foot if not coming from the highway.

The couple who took us from Caserta left us at this gas station and we first try to ask the people around but it's not working we have tried for 2 hours after that we just wrote a cardboard and went just nex to the Shell towards the exit and we got a ride in 5 mins ;)
Really good spot for turin. A tipical man brought me in the city center.

a petrolstation on autostrada A4 (E64), a good relay on a MILANO - TORINO trip. there is also a smaller snack bar and cafe inside. it can take a while until drivers take you to TORINO, in my case around one hour, though, the driver brought me right to the city-center of my destination. this place lies in the middle of nowhere; please do not expect too much comfort, the station is of an older type and not very clean. beware of pickpockets, there seemed to be a lot of gypsies  stopping at this pla

We started at Rimini Nord toll booth and easily got a ride here. It was very hot in the morning so we didn't want to wait. After 10 minutes a camper driver saw us waving from afar and came back to pick us up. He took us to Samoggia a little town after Bologna.  One girl one boy.

We waited for hour and a half to get a ride in direction Padova. A majority of cars seems to go in direction Milano, and many of them go just to Bologna. Very good spot to go in direction Milano and average for going to Padova and direction A, SLO, HR.

Still works in 2025! When your coming from the fields there is a spot on the left side of the fence where can jump over really easily because of a small breakage. 
There are only a few cars going to the gas station but the second person we approached gave us a lift directly to the city center in Florence.
First person we asked took us to the Autogrill near Pontedera from where we caught a ride to Florence straight away.

This is the best place to hitchhike from Pisa in direction of Firenze (but it works also to Rome, and Milan, north and south). It's a gas station on the highway. You can reach it with a public bus that you take in front of the Train Station in Pisa. You have to stop in Via Marcello Malpighi (Ospedaletto), and from there walk through the field. I put another point on the bus station. The 4th car picked us up, and all of them were very friendly, that is not very common in Italy. You might need to

Not a lot of traffic and it seems to be going all directions (BO, ROMA, PI), and I agree -- it's insanely hard to get to, it's like they're hiding the Italian gold reserves there. We crossed from the eastbound side of the gas station and had to (in total) cross two ditches and three fences. However there is a path through the very dense shrubbery on the westbound side, look for the spray-painted arrow on the walking path that goes around the station.

good spot, found a ride in 35min passed lucca. not many cars, many locals. Not easy to reach tho, i cycled 40min to the uni close by, then walked 30min, then went through many bushes and i climbed 2 fences... maybe there is an easier way but i didn't find it
good place to catch in the direction to lukka however its hard to get to the spot

Amazing spot to go to Schio, since it's a local, scenic route with no public transport. There's not much traffic, still I got picked up within 5 minutes.

Used a "Schio" sign.

If you're looking to get over the mountain towards Schio and Vicenza this might be a quicker route then trying to hitch to Verona and then around (or maybe if you want to visit the 52 Gallerie at the top). Just as you go up the hill the street is narrow but the lane closest to the river opens into another for cars to park and makes a good place for drivers to stop. Hitched it twice and had good results (a sign is useful)-

Ps: great scenic route! :)

I arrived from Fabriano and continued towards Rimini. Friendly people waving and smiling from cars and buses. There's lane enough to stop within the roundabout. A family picked me up.
As long as it gathers drivers from Jesi and Fabriano free highway, this spot serves the south direction too. If not, Ancona south toll can be better.
See you in 5!
Good place to start from Ancona since it's close to the airport and is the entrance for North or South of the A14.

We needed to get to Germany. Most of the cars were Italians, a few Switz cars as well. After 2 hours, we changed our "Germany" sign for "Como" (the town just before the Switz borders) and got a ride in 20 minutes to a petrol station in front of Como.

That's my experience. However, two friends who started hitchhiking right after we got the ride and used the same signs got stuck at the petrol station for 7 hours with no lift anywhere north towards the A9 highway. 

Overall, I would say it's a
Good spot to go to Switzerland

A good location if you want to travel to Switzerland or Germany. There's a lot of traffic, even at 1 a.m. We managed to reach Frankfurt am Main (Germany) in 60 minutes during our drive in August 2022.
Perfect spot. 20 minutes with sign "UDINE"
Nice place to go South, we were lucky and we found a ride to Udine almost immediately, a woman was going from Tarvisio to Udine and stopped there to go to a shop.
Went here after stop from Innsbruck, waited here for couple of minutes. Nice couple goes to RateÄe but taked us to bus stop after Kranjska Gora
Got a ride here to Jesenice, Slovenia. It was heavily raining though. Otherwise, I think I would have waited more.
The first car i asked got me to Bologna. i as lucky maybe. But asking works definitely well

If you come from the railway station of stradella, theres a roadmap in the station, where you can see the way to the gas station. Once you reach the end of the city, dont follow the main road that is only for cars and turns towards the gas station but turn left onto a road that is closed with red barriers. The railroad crossing is closed as well but if you are careful and slip through the barrier you will reach the gas station from behind.

Relatively big service area which in fact turns it very difficult to harness. Autogrill and petrol station are separated, meaning you cannot attack clients of both. At the highway entrance the cars are already going fast so they are not likely to stop there. The cardboard approach will definitely not work here, in my experience the best way is to camp in front of the autogrill and ask people returning to their cars, interleaved with a quick round at the truck parking lot behind.

Also, be carefu
15 mins in the dark of a winter night - 19:00 - good (enough) place for cars to stop and there are enough passing through even in the evening
Good spot if you're heading towards Milano. Cars don't go too fast and enough space for them to stop.
With a sign for Ljubljana, got a ride for Zagreb quickly
walked while hitchhiking, no car stopped, walked all the way to slovenia and crossed the borders, then 2 hours of hitching at a gas station until someone finally took us to ljub
Tram to Opicina, then walk to the end of the town and hh in front of the NLB bank

Direction : Ljubljana / Slovenia
If you manage to go there (there is a train from Trieste going up there), it's a good place. Waited 1/2 hour.
Got a long ride towards Wien almost instantly. Great spot, easy access.

(Boy and girl) We hitchhiked here twice, the first one was 15min waiting to catch a car with a panel of Venice and the second time it was 20min waiting to catch a car with a panel of Venice as well. the only inconvenient of this spot if the Huge panel of NO AUTOSTOP but well police passed lot of times and we were pretending talking haha
In front of highway gate Padova Est. Get here by bus 18 and drop off on the bridge over the highway. Reach the spot by foot through the Ikea park place.

The review on the north side pin is really accurate! The gate on the south side was open when i came, showers are working either at the petrol station and downstairs the restaurant on this side.
Ä° tried my first solo tablediving here thanks to a cute american family sitting next to me wasting a big rice mozzarella dish.
Nearly 10 drivers stopped but they all were going north, a truck driver polish lady came to offer me food, a man stopped just to show me his drum while i was playing mine :D i

With bicycle, waited about 6hrs for a ride towards Milano/Switzerland, ended up taking a ride to Innsbruck. There is quite a lot of traffic here! Italians generally were evasive, foreigners generally didn't have space. Ended up getting a ride to Innsbruck. There is amazing tablediving here!!
Maybe Asian are less easily to get lift from italian...

Take a bus from Bologna to somewhere here(comes over the bridge and stops close behind the runabout) and then u can walk (back) to the petrol station. To go north cross the highway at the brigdebuilding!!! (i took the tracks-mud!!!)
went north, dont speak italy, took about 20 min...
Good spot
great place to get a lift to any direction south or north. we were there just  2 days before. after getting there, dont worry to get anywhere..
We were heading to Firenze and one guy took us into his sport Alfa Romeo and drop us to the city centre.

Autogrill on the A1, lots of traffic going south to Rome and beyond.  Other side should be good for getting north past Firenze.  See Firenze page for details on how to get here.  Got a ride, a home cooked meal, and a free pair a jeans!

Only waited for 15 minutes. Asked every person leaving the autogrill returning to their cars. Only got taken to Bergamo, but the direction was good.

two male hitchhikers.
Summer 2025

Lots of traffic but not many wanting to drive me to Venice. Went to the exit and waited there instead of asking. Got a quick ride to Brescia. A working said it was a hard spot but I didnâ€™t find it to bad
aftr 1,5 hour wainting in rain at an other gas station this was more easy to get a ride to Venezia. and directly!

somewhat bad place for me (headed to Genova), it took a while to talk my way into a ride,around 1:30 hours in the mid day, but with help of the station workers I got a ride to just south of Milano to a gas station

You can reach this Petrol station from Gessate the last stop of Metro 2 Green Line and after that walking and arrive there without walking on highway check the map( but you can lost easily if you don't have a map so i advice the spot on cologno nord,easier to reach) it's full of cars and foreigner trucks i found a ride asking to truck-drivers after 5 minutes!!
A smaller Autogrill, not that much traffic, but still got a ride to Lugano train station (exactly where I wanted to go) by a german couple in less than 10 minutes
Good spot in summer. Don't know why was full pf switzerland cars. A german girl drop me at basel
train to Abbiategrasso, sorry ËÂ´Ë™`

A quite small petrol station with Autogrill. 
It is theoretically a good spot to hitch away from Milano but its quite hard getting there by public transportation. I took an S-train direction Abbiaragate to the station Cesano Boscone and from there bus 323 to D'Acquisto-Liberta stop at the roundabout. From there you have to cross a kind of natural park which then ends and you have to walk through 2 fields crossing two small "rivers", for the first there is a tree put as natural bridge, the second
decent spot for getting lifts towards como/varese/switzerland
Not to much people(who gives a rideðŸ˜ª). A guy drope in a gas station at cesano boscone full of switzeland cars

On a sunday i waited the whole day but the place was really dead, the only ones who stopped were going back to milan.
I speak italian so i asked everyone in the station but got no luck at all, maybe i'll try again tomorrow.
Only 30 minutes to south itâ€™s great spot. We got from Milan to Sanremo ride but also Genova and Monaco is very good spot
There's a 1m high fence around the gas station, but there are places, where it can be easily crossed. Stand: march'23

Very good place for hitchhiking, but You have to remember about smile and good attitude, because hitchhike in Italy is not so comon and You have to ask people who don't speak English, but in this point even service of this station helped us! Only 10 min waiting!

One of the crazier spots out there. Not sure whick hand to wave as theyre cars going on both sides. Feels dangerous, as the drivers sometimes hesitate which way they want to go. Your visable and thereâ€™s plenty room to spot. Got a ride to Milano with no sign almost right away. 

Minus one star, because you feel, like a crazy person interrupting traffic.

Waited here a long time without getting a ride. I wanted to go to Brenner, Austria, but most cars went to Milano or Verona. Therefore its better for this directions, but not really for going northwards. I stood in front of the sign but the most time next to the parking lot. As I went to the spot behind the toll station an Italian guy stopped and said its forbidden to stay there. After that I went to the big roundabout.
Had 4 cars stop in 25minutes of hitchhiking before finding a ride going our direction (Milano), recommend a sign since cars going both in the direction of Venezia and Milano pass by.
scary spot, looks like it is already on the highway, but worked well for us
A good spot, many cars, people can stop, but sign is indeed necessary! I got a ride after 20 minutes in direction of Venezia to the last Area di Servizio before Verona

decent spot. the entrance is behind a gate and the entire station is behind a tall barbed wire fence. there is one spot where it is hoppable at time of writing (by going through Via Pietro Nenni).
much better luck asking around than standing at the end. not that much traffic, but a lot of it going to rome. staff is supportive, one guy came to bring me chocolates and advise on how to talk to police if they bother me :)

At the end of the week of the 15th of august, we ( a girl and a boy) tried to come back in the north of france from Napoli! We began at 1PM from this gas station, by asking people (i'm speaking italian), we found in 5mn a car for Firenze. After in an other gas station, in 5mn we found a car to Milan. It was 10PM and we found a car from the East of France in 30 40mn!

Perfect! Thanks a lot!
We were a couple, we got a lift by asking people. The guy was quite nice, he paid us the train ticket to finish our trip 60km after Roma.

We were two (boy and girl) and we got a ride Rome with an old couple, don't try to ask people in the middle of a day they are shy try to stand with a sign near by the exit. BTW, the way to theenterence of this gas station is passing inside a private property but no problem nobody is there anymore ;)

3 people waited 30 minutes for a ride North from here.  From behind McDonalds at Naples central station take bus "Caserta" to Via Largo Rotunda.  Walk back the direction the bus came two blocks and walk West to arrive at the petrol station.
2 guys, catched a ride to Luzern really fast. Great spot if you want to go to Switzerland.
Friday morning, not many people going to Switzerland. After two hours someone took me to Baden
It was pretty easy to get a ride here. I was even too lazy to ask ppl and just showed my banner - 30 minutes. You'll be even quicker with asking Swiss or German cars.
We were heading to Varese so it took us some time. It appears MANY cars go to Como so that should be quite an easy route to take...
good spot for getting to switzerland. took us a while, but it was quite late.
There's a small gas station and a traffic light, so I could ask every driver as soon as the light turned red. Everyone is hitting the highway here. I got a ride to Bologna after 40 minutes.
A great spot, a car stopped after 5 min. Got a ride to Tortona.

In this place there's a gas station and a traffic light. It's a good place to get a ride to the south by A7.

http://hitchwiki.org/en/Milano
Nice spot to Trento, use a sign!

Great spot if you're heading north, but quiet bad to get in the south...
Police drove by without problems.

Very good spot. 
Cars are slow and thereÂ´s space to pull over.

I waited not even 5 minutes heading North.
This is I think best legal option to stand in this area. Direction Bolzano. All the car entering the roundabout can see you and then stop at the parking place behind you.
Arrived by ferry (which i paid for) in Ancona. I stood near the exit for cars with my prepared sign, and someone stopped in less than 10 minutes and took me to an Autogrill in Bologna.

Harbour of Ancona.
While it's a little hard to hitchhike in Italy here a lot of cars arrive with a ferry coming from greece, Mostly in holiday seasons a lot of cars heading France and germany. A little hard to ask because everyone is so upset with all the traffic but possible to ask when they come out from the ferrys.

I went to that place with the Bus because I thought it might be the best Spot for hitchhiking to Bolzano. This might not be false but directly at the Spot is a big sign wich says "no autostop" . One police car was also driving next to me, but they didnt do anything. I still tried to get a ride there but the cars were a little bit to fast and had no really good Option to stop. Furthermore there was absolutly no shadow and it was extremly hot so I had to quit hitchhiking after 20-30 minutes..
Ask people at the Lago di Garda to take you there :))
On-ramp spot direction Affi.
3 ppl going south. Found quite quickly asking people filling up their cars

From this gas station you can got a lift. The entrance is from Via Mantova. It's a long way on foot from the city center (almost 1 hour) and I don't know if there is any public transportation to get there. I got a lift after 1 hour.

We were hitchiking with a "Germany" sign for like 15 minutes and got a ride to Zurich. The driver was going all the way to Strasbourg though. It was a French car. Overall, there's a lot of Switz cars, some French and German. Everyone's going north. 

Side note: Be careful, in Switzerland the EU phone tariffs don't apply and the prices for phone services skyrocket. Make sure to make your plans before you enter.
Got a ride to Milano in 5 minutes and a ride to Bellinzona in about an hour. Good place for both directions. Give a smile to the station attendants so they wont bother you.
This is a good gas station to get a ride into Switzerland. People here go all the way to Basel and at least through the Gotthard tunnel.
It's rather a small station, and most people I approached said they were staying local. I would probably not have waited so long if I hadn't had my bicycle with me.
I got a direct ride to Frascati (10 km from Rome) after 40 mins!

Traffic very good, we standed 20m before gas station. Its possible to catch car, if you have cardboard with destination. Remember that's Italy, not easiest place for hitchhikers 
Good luck :)
Good spot, got a ride to lake garda. Stand in the corner of the gas station enterenceway. Where the road starts.

I was asking almost all people entering autogrill bar, I had a "Genova" sign with me. Most people were heading east (Piacenza, Venezia, Bologna) while the others (some of them going south) were simply refusing to take me. Finally, after more than two hours, I asked sb to take me to the Alessandria's train station (the first person I asked, agreed) and I continued by train.

If you go east, the place seems to be very good.
I was asking drivers toward Piacenza e bologna, got friendly reactions and in 45min a ride to a petrol station 40min away. Nice

Not a lot of people came by, but the ones that did were mostly kind. And one of them gave us a ride back to Trento Sud to go south on our way to Trieste. If you stay there long enough you will probably get a ride east through Valsugana.

good spot towards the entrance to the highway, but be careful cars are mostly heading towards Firenze and its hard to stop at the entrance, so if ur heading towards Bologna id rather take the non-highway route and go city by city.

Good spot towards the highway, but I would not recommend going towards the highway if you are heading towards Bologna, since there is not much place to stop for cars before the entrance to the highway and in front of the gate it is illegal, we waited there around 4 hours, so id only hitchhike towards the highway if ur heading towards Firenze, otherwise try taking the non-highway route to Bologna.

its an ok spot. there a bit a space for cars to stop
no one did in a huor. i was lucky, i asked two guys that walked passed me and drove me into the highway at the first gas station
watch out for police
good place to get on the highwaY, watch out for police
the spot is ok, theres a little space for the cars to stop...loads of them passing. a lovely couple on their 60s got me quite far
Nice spot just before the tunnel as road going right is closed so makes a good spot for cars to stop. Found a ride with a sign to Limone pretty quick.
2 guys, catched a ride to Latisana in an hour with a sign
Good for hitchhiking when you want to get on the highway (both north and south).

Probably the best spot to hitchhike out of Messina but still not a good spot. There are some place for the cars to stop but not so much and lots of cars cant see you because of a fence. I got a lift to the first autogrill on the way to Palermo.
We waited for 30 min with a panel indicating Lienz/Villach to get a ride to Lienz.
Good spot. Ask to get out of Brunico to the main road. Percha is good.

Smaller autogrill, got lucky quickly tho. Ok spot for diverting into the north.
Two male hitchhikers
Summer 2025
You can get in the gas station by a small gate in the fence from the road behind the station. Technically illegal but no one seemed to care.
Almost no traffic, but it's possible to get to Termoli. I think that this is good in italian standards of hitchhiking
You can get on SS16 to Cerignola or to Foggia if you are lucky.
Probably there is no chance for a long ride, but I got really quickly to Barletta, people are nice.
the spot it's okay forncars to stop there is enough space in the roundabout, i made It to Genova, make sure to have a sign:)

Not sure how to get here, another driver got me here.
Got a ride to Verona offered in less then 10 minutes. Wanted to go to Switzerland so I only took it to Autogrill Secchia Est near Modena, which had a little bit more traffic.

2 girls

We took the second car who stopped and we got a ride straight to the entrance of the highway as we wanted !

Every local will stop to take you just  few citys\villages but you can just dont pay the ticket for the train to Milan, they dont check the Tickets often. If your a tourist just talk in your local language and they will kick you out at the next Station and you can take the next train (if your a tourist it prettymuch works in everey regional train in Italy)

Not the best spot, few space to stop for the cars but the road i straight to the france and the landsvape is BEAUTIFULL. there are some french cars who come back from italy, and the road pass from the alpes and a outstanding lake. If you want to be fast is better walk 40 minuts back there is a spot for the hightway.

On the other side of the roundabout (towards padua) theres a motel with what looks like another good spot, since it combines fraffic from all directions towards padua. Didnâ€™t get a chance to try it out, because wuickly i found a pleasant ride to Padua centro.
Nice spot to get to Belluno
I was walking along the road while hitchhiking, there are very few cars but people are really nice, got a car to Lavagna

People passing be were interested and slow down to read the signs (we were creating a small traffic gem)

The spot is propably as good as it gets around here.
The spot seems quite good, slowly moving cars and a good amount of them.
A lot of people going towards Rimini, a lot of space for cars to stop

The traffic is not bad, we used a combination of one guy asks at the door of the autogrill and the second tries with a thumb up, eventually got a car using the thumb to Pisa, but I would try asking the foreign cars in person to maximise chances since Italians simply wont stopðŸ¥²

Okay place, not much time for cars to decide, but it works, we used a sign for Florence, there is a trash can at the parking where we found cardboard so id recommend making a sign, since right away the first car we showed the sign to stopedðŸ˜†
Good spot for genova or further. I was aimimg Milano, a young chinese couple was goimg to Ginevra. They drop me in alessandria. A lot of cars in summer, a lot of turists.
good for local rides along the SS1. the bus wasnâ€™t passing, but within 5 minutes i got a ride to 2 towns over.
Itâ€™s properly a little illegal spot (not dangerous) but we got a ride to Piacenza within 10min. Dont know if itâ€™s possible to go here by public transport.
A truck driver took pity on us in the heat an took us too Parma.
We got a ride 20km down the road, on the way to Parma. Might be a good spot going towards Parma but there is no shadow so avoid on hot days.
We waited 10minuts for a ride to mantova.
2 hours of waiting, Italians usually don't stop, I have bene lucky to find two tourists moving to Ancona.

Great spot, loads of traffic going into italy. At the busstop is great but anywhere on a spot where cars can stop is great!!
We hitchhiked before the bus station and it was quite okay. But no shadow to hide from the sun
We were going from Mestre to Triest, a lot of trucks if you're lucky they will take you. But sometimes cars stop there for toilet.
A long road, the driver go slowly because there's a turn. Near this point is a camping site for van. I took 30min from here to chatillon.
A lot of cars drive through here, but not many stop

Super lucky found Czech guys (we are also Czech) they were going home and so were we.

We got lucky and found a Czech guy going our way (we are also czech) so he took us but if he didnâ€™t it would prolly take a bit longer CZU it was later as well. 

We were tryna get to Venice but not many ppl were going there surprisingly.
Very random, some guy stopped after 3 minutes. It seemed that Canazei was  pretty frequent spot with big parking lots. Keep smilin!

Young woman took me and my friend to Rocca Pietore. There we stopped to Lago de Fedaia. I like stopping cars in smaller villages, people are likely to stop and help. Keep smiling and have a positive energy!

Good spot to go West out of Venosta Valley, kind of an awkward spot with nowhere to pull over and right on a corner. We stood on the opposite side of the road and flagged down cars who were just coming out of Glurns. Got a ride fairly quickly to the Swiss border

It was not too busy in summer Monday around 14. But not empty either. I was directly asking for a ride to Genova/Alessandria and got one. Going to get off at one other gas station before Alessandria. I would not take shorter ride as there are not too many rest stops.
Trip to Castellana Grotte. Very busy road, hopefully I found a night ride (11. 30 pm). Friendly people

small gas station, i was lucky someone drove into the highway and dropped me there
a french young couple picked me up after not too long of asking to people
no one from the staff bothered me
watch out for police tho

easy spot at the bus stop
direction brescia, an old dude drove 10km south

A guy and a girl.
It's not a perfect spot because there is not a ton of space where to park, but the cars go decently slow.
We held up a sign that read "SUD".
We got lucky and got picked very quickly by a great guy. We initially asked him to bring us to Rijeka, but ended up travelling with him until Gospic.

The best spot to go back after a day at the lake. From here it's very easy to catch a ride to Iseo but also possible to go to Brescia. Convenient place but the side of the road may be blocked by parked cars in summer.

If you find yourself in Franciacorta outlet this is gonna be one of the few stops to get out. From here it's easier to catch a ride to Brescia although still possibile to go to Iseo. Some people on the roundabout aren't taking the exit so no point in trying to signal them. There's a conad, a gym and a gas station nearby so it's possible to go asking around if someone's headed where you're going. Easier to get out with a sign.
Not a lot of cars going to Guspini, but lot to San Gavino
Quite a good spot, some very open minded guy took us to Alberobello, and also he showed us his trulli and house haha

Great spot if you're going north to Trento, we (two guys) had multiple people signaling and one person offering to take us. A bit difficult for cars to stop so Trucks will generally not slow down. With a sign to Verona we got a ride in about an hour.
Small space for cars to stop but doable. Close to big commercial center.

Found a ride for three people to the next autostrada ramp (direction cefalu). Didn't took long to find a ride, but we had to walk a bit out of Capo d'Orlando to get there. There is enough space to stop and some shade to wait during the midday heat
Not many cars, but a lot of them are from Austria

Pros - well equipped Decathlon beside, large roundabout to wait, good spot to drop off while arriving from Modena, 1,50â‚¬ train by Casalecchio Palasport station or bus from Ceretolo Vivaldi (Riale is 2,20)
Cons - this spot takes you into the main road to Bologna and potentially into the highway but you should be sure whether driver goes north, east or south so that you don't get stuck on the highway.

After trying the highway spot and cannot get any ride, we decided to try from here and got a ride in 20min to Monfalcone. 
There are lot of people driving but few people stopping. We were taken by a family from Romania.
Great spot, lots of traffic which has room to slow down and pick you up. You can get a ride on the local roads when being modest with the distane travelled quite quickly. We were going to the west.

Tried with a sign to Palmanova. We were not disappointed by the kindness of Italian people. Within 30 minutes we got a ride into our desired destination. This might not be the best spot, but  if you want to avoid hitchhiking on the highway, it might just do.
Parking just before the entry to the highway.

Nice little gas station with a pastry shop. Has very good traffic, most of which are Germans headed to the South of Italy.
It was late at night (around 2 am) when I got here and there was still some traffic. Here I charged up my phone and the worker lady gave me some delicious pizza for free after I asked if I could have some food. Ended up making friends with a Turkish truck driver who also fed me and gave me the upper bed in his truck to sleep.
In the morning I easuly found a ride in the dir

Have space that cars can easily stop. But there was no shade, I was having hard time under sun. Wanted to go to Bergamo but ended up riding to Brescia. Learned that most of the people riding Brescia instead of Bergamo.
Took a ride to Marone, not easy road for cars to stop but lovely lady took me who was riding Marone for aperativo :D
I think is a good place to go South or to Trieste, we found a ride directly to Bologna that was our destination. Medium traffic but not a lot
Got a ride in 5minutes at 8am, lot of cars going to ferrara. Enough space to pull over
This was good. We were two (boy and girl) and wanted to go to Palermo. A tourist dropped us off in Trapani.
Very friendly guy took us to near city where is beautiful Sanctuary. It has something best in world so google it. We were two and no sign.
Less cars but very friendly people there so it didnt take time to stop someone
Within 15min we got taken in one drive straight to the center of CatÃ¡nia. Better here than in the village center of Trecastagni where there's more local traffic.
It's a toll before entering the highway. Stand adls far as possible from the toll, so a car has space to stop. Relatively good spot for hitchhiking to Trieste/Slivenia area.

I got a ride to Rome after 20 minutes. In the meantime, another guy going to Avezzano stopped as well. 
Not great for cars to pull over, but traffic is heavy and relatively slow.
Enough place for the cars to stop but as everywhere in Italy, its difficult to get a lift. I tried with a sign to Rimini. After 30 minutes i got a lift.
The petrol station is not so busy, you can also try to hitchhike next to the road. After 15 minutes the first car that came into the station picked me up and took straight to San Marino.
I got a lift to the first petrol station in 15 minutes. Enough place for the cars to stop.
Its possible to hitchhike from here to the first petrol station
Not so much cars, but i got a lift easily to the next gas station. There is enough place for the cars to stop.

than, correct direction: get via Vermea, 100m on the left of the bus stop, go thru for 1 km approx, check on the left for Via Napoli, do not take the overpass but the small country road on the left --- you already see the petrol station from the beginning of via Napoli :-)

There was space for the cars to stop and a guy took me to a better hitchhiking place(the gas station near the italy/slovenia border. I was prepared to wait for longer as the road was quite small and many cars were not going towards the border.
50% of cars going north towards brenner. Good option to stop (bus stop, crosswalk)

Short distance but people are going to direction of marmelÃ¡da from there too. It was late and we were just tryna get a place to sleep BUT I bet you could get a ride more towards Marmolada mountain easily
Many local cars, but i was lucky i got a ride to the gas station at the highway, that's a better spot for going south. :)
Got here from the toll station where I was kicked out of by police lol (luckily no fine). Got a ride to Borgomanero train station.
Not the greatest spot but getting out of Feriolo is possibly the best spot. Need to walk up from the road at the lake.
Few cars coming but the people are very friendly here

Good station if you want to get to La Spineza. We catch a ride to Pisa in 2h
Most people go to Milan or somwhere near. You can catch some people going in both direction Swiss/ Easte Italy
the spot is just a gas station...theresl was a guy working there and a sign saying NO AUTOSTOP, but literally the first van i asked to drove to to Arenzano, about 30km away

decent spot for cars to stop, if going south its quite difficult cus theres loads of locals
eventually someone drove me to mori, closer to the highway

We were trying to catch a ride in direction to Oristano, to Sassari or Nuoro. We caught a ride to Nuoro after like 30 minutes. High traffic, but lots of locals, most cars weren't going to the highway. But its next to pedestrian's crossing, so cars go a bit slower, there's space for car to stop too and you're quite visible
(Midday, 29.7.2024) Waited through thousands of cars, with a sign for venezia and bergamo, finally got lucky with tourists that dropped me in Venice, not thÃ© perfect spot

I was leaving the main celebration "Gigli" the morning after to south so drivers knew what i was there for at least, but no one picked me up. Just one offer to Napoli. The strong sun made me go back to the train station. Hitchhiking adventure began once in Cilento area.

Narrow toll entrance road, illegal to stop after the roundabout, carpooling happens on the exit side of the toll booth. If you stand at the roundabout, then you miss the cars coming from Urbino. I would recommend this spot only in case of low traffic. Go to other wider toll booths otherwise. Marotta, Riccione, Rimini North (Santarcangelo station). I'm heading to Rimini north by train, let's see how it goes :)
We got a lift to Gas Station at the Highway to geht to venice. On the opposite site it is possoble to hitchhike on the  Strada Statale to Venice.
was very bad for heading north for us, eventually were picked up to affi. direction west and south probably better here.  good luck!
Wanted to hitchhike to Zone but few car were passing. Waited a little but eventually very nice family took me to Zone.
A lot of traffic, but not the best spot since there is a lot of road connections and thereâ€™s a bit of confusion. Found an italian couple headed to Graz.
seems like a good spot dir. arenzano, maybe we just had bad luck. first ride got us a few kilometers further
We (boy and girl) waited in the sun in the roundabout. After 40 minutes stopped a car directly to Palermo.

This is a well-shaped spot to get into the highway crossing Cilento natural park. Cars drive slowly and do have a lane to stop. Unf it takes a lot as a guy alone. Coastal road is quicker to get picked up.
Not hitchhiking, but asking people on the parking spot. If you want to get to Palermo, you'll find someone fast enough. To Castellammare I got a ride in 25 minutes.
Direction Lienz. Not much space for bigger vehicles to stop, but there is bus station nearby. Dont know wich spot is better.

We happened to get picked up (direction Noto) after not too long, but there are not many cars passing by and it's probably better to try on the other side of Lido di Noto. On the upside there is an obscure Ancient Greek tower 5 minutes from this spot so +1 for that.

We got taken relatively fast to the area we wanted to go (the surroundings of Lido de Noto) and there's space to pull over. However, the road is a bit dangerous to cross/reach by foot. The location is also quite sketchy with a lot of garbage and stray dogs. I suppose there are better spots.
Spot to Comacchio, RA8 -> East

Moderately good to go north (direction Feltre) or south (direction Treviso). The SR348 goes up to Feltre in Belluno's province. There's a lot of cars in the parking area of Mc Donalds and the supermarkets.

Heading south. There is really few and almost only local traffic. Its a bad spot to go on long distances. Everyone we asked, was taking the next exit. But People are very nice and friendly. Finally someone took us to the city center.
Not the best spot. Not so much cars going on the way to Bari. Try to get a lift to Masafra. From there, its really easy.
Difficult but not impossible spot to hitchhike to Messina.

Noce spot, car can stop and you can go in pretty much all directions from here. Beware   Bolognesi are not big fans of hitchhikers but  somebody will eventually stop; I wanted to go to venice/padua, wrote a sign with padova/ ferrara A13 and it helped.
This petrol station doesnt work so cars dont stop here. Its not a highway so you can hitchhike next to the road but the cars are fast.

I had to wait for very long here trying to head south then only got a ride to a better spot heading more south at the petrol station.
It should be a good spot, but it wasnt for me Monday morning in Feb
I thnk this spot doesn't exists anymore because they canged the motorway entrance...

Spot has very few traffic. The small 'petrol station' got about 1 car in 15 minutes on a sunday late morning. !Bring a sign to show to passing traffic!) There was a small booth but on sunday it was only self service.
I hitchhiked heading south from here.
I've gotten some pretty good rides into the A22 from that petrol station. Lots of space for the drivers to stop and many of them aren't coming very fast.

2ppl, one standing with a sing, the other asking drivers at the gas station.
Full holiday season, should be better on working days.
Most cars going to milan.

Cars did not stop for us, tried on 2 different days. We looked like casual backpackers, 2 people m and f. Signs written with Verona and Trieste.

good spot with enough space for cars to stop. waited about 45min to get a lift to a petrol station on the highway direction milano
waited here around an hour to get a ride to Brescia. many people are going to milano !!!
We got very lucky, getting picked up by an off duty police officer. Donâ€™t recommend this place going south, unless you need to. North is properly pretty good

This is not that good spot to stand. We have stood there for 2 hours and nothing. Try to stand at the enetering of  the roundabout. There is a small parking place where cars can stop. It took us 30 min after finding this place to srand.

Small gas station in the middle of big complex of shops and reastaurants near the highway. Also closest place near highway to Lago di Garda. After three hours we get ride to trento. Better place is behind traffic roundabout just before highway tollhouse, wich is unfortuneatly ilegal.
Rather narrow and fast road to the autostrada, cars dont really have an opportunity to stop without disturbing the traffic

Probably one of the better spots for hitchhiking to direction La Spezia in Genova. Genova is full of narrow streets making it almost impossible for cars to stop. There is exit form parking lot, a little place for car to stop. The traffic is also very sparse traffic.

Almost impossible to get a ride back to France, the Italians do not take hitchhikers.

Hopefully a French-Italian woman took me and a friend. (Oct. 2017)

From Genoa to Cogoleto and you should walk west from Cogoleto don't take way for pedestrians, which is going just paralel to sea. Just walk from the national road at the end of cogoleto (there is bride on the right). BTW, that road we walked was the most beatiful part of our travel awesome view. The place we hitchhike was amazing we found a ride in 2 mins when we were walking towards the exit road :)

One of the worst places to stop. We were there about 3 hours, tried multiple spots near the bod, even on the other side near to the petrol station. It was horribly hot, most of the cars coldnâ€™t see us properly, standing next to Italian policeâ€¦ Very bad place to stop, avoid it all costs.

Not the best spot in the world and maybe the worst spot in world duo to the huge panel of NO AUTOSTOP, we hitchhiked (boy and girl) from this spot to Venice and after 30min (lucky us police didn't come) a woman offered us a ride to Padova and a place where to stay! we were the luckiest persons in the world

Ha, I was bold enough and almost got a ride from someone, but they where going the wrong way for me (west to Milan)
luckily the parents of a person of a person i had just met, where kind enough to take me to the next gas station (west) good place there!
but here is a hit or miss
Well, if you are bold enough to hitchhike just after a huge "no autostop" sign and just meters away from the motorway police headquarters...

toll gate (casello) Verona Sud --- easily reachable thru bus n. 61 from train station: drop at the first stop in via Torricelli. enter viale delle Nazioni, pass by a car dealer, make your way to the toll gate thru a quite big road and a parking lot --- cars go any direction from there, there's room to pull over, stand with sign! :-)
Nobody here was going to Triest, most cars went to Venice airport or Jesolo.

Unfortunate and bad at the same time. We walked ( 2 guys) from Mestre/Venice to get a ride to Udine/Palmanova. When we arrived 1 cars was freshly robbed! Police came told us that we cant stop cars. For about 2 hours we waited till the police left. Then we tried to asked drivers on the petrol station but the staff told us that we can do it only next to the entrance ir near to the shop next to the petrol station. So we devided one took a sign and went to the exit to take cars from petrol station a

Asked around and got a ride from a very nice local going to Udina. He took us to the other station near Udine (Palmanova) at the highway intersecting direction Slovenia-Austria. He went and asked other italian people for 5 mins to pick us up next. Very funny guy. The gas station is filled with locals so you have to asked around and be ready to wait a bit.

Gas station on the highway. You can reach it by foot.

Second time hitching at this spot. The first time (March 2022 - 2 guys) we waited a couple of hours to find a ride. This time (October 2024 - 1 guy) it took about 20 minutes. Both times there weren't that much traffic and quite a lot of cars where stopping at the airport.
No body took me to south

From this spot or gas station is possible to get to pay toll only, not to highway. It is very hard (or impossible?) to get out from bolzano

For some reason many drivers in this area have frowned or done the "che cazzo vuoi?" (what the fuck) hand sign to me when h-hiking with a sign for a very long distance. I got better results with a sign that said Verona.

was standing there with a sign rome written on it and trento on the backside and playing guitar to attract eyes of drivers i was taken but i waited a long time like 1 or 2 hours maybe  even more so i mark it under 3 hours waiting time

I don't know for entering in Milano, but ton continue to the east of Italy, quite difficult. Good luck comrads ;)
Much traffic,a lot of tourists. Easy to get a lift to Milano.

I got incredibly lucky as a Romanian truck driver picked me up (the BEST people) and I had a sign to Genova, but ended up going further as I wanna get to San Marino. Hard to get into this spot as i walked on the road, and police came and waved a finger no, but i ignored them and thankfully got a lift quickly after
A great spot for hitching the trucks heading to southern Europe (Spain), but incredibly hard to get out of this place. You get stuck and can't leave
Hard to go away from here.

Got lucky that some workers were opening the gate as soon as I got to the station. Not sure if access is possible otherwise. No sign, asking people directly. Most foreigners were down but usually had full cars, a couple of Italians on their way to Vicenza dropped me off in Bologna.
Waited quite a long time (with my bike); there's not too much traffic, but a fair amount of the traffic has foreign license plates. Nice olive fields just outside the gates for camping.

From Firenze to Antella you can go with the bus 31-32. From Antella you can get to the other side of the motorway through the Autogrill bridge-restaurant/shop. There is good traffic. In every minutes at least one car goes back to the motorway. It's good, because there is a patrol station and a restaurant too. But one problem that almost in every car sat old Italian people who don't trust in strangers. Though we are a couple dressed well, nobody stopped us, and when we went to people to ask them,
